code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:54 YO white male presents via EMS a short time following MVA. he was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the back of the head (LOC 59 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 15 mph on impact. patient c/o moderate nausea, severe headache, mild vomiting and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 66 in, Weight 136 lbs, Temperature 98.5 F, Pulse 73, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:white male swimmer aged 54 yrs presents for one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 59 min). he denies headache, vomiting and nausea since the accident. he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. denies any smoking describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 7 days in his past o:Height 65 in, Weight 132 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 73, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.46, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
